title: La Voix's Theatrical Transition: Embodying Miss Hannigan on the Annie UK Tour
summary: La Voix, a prominent drag queen and television personality, has been cast as Miss Hannigan in the forthcoming UK tour of the Annie musical, scheduled to commence in May 2026. The tour will initiate in Wimbledon and progress through major cities such as Birmingham, Manchester, Plymouth, Canterbury, Cardiff, Milton Keynes, and Edinburgh, with an extended itinerary in 2027 including Norwich, Sheffield, and Glasgow. In her statement, La Voix conveyed profound excitement, characterizing Miss Hannigan as a loud, chaotic, and glamorously disheveled figure, which she believes aligns perfectly with her performative style. This role has historical significance, having been portrayed by esteemed actors like Paul O'Grady, Craig Revel Horwood, and Miranda Hart, adding a layer of legacy to her appointment. Concurrently, the article references La Voix's abrupt departure from Strictly Come Dancing due to an injury, underscoring the physical demands and unpredictability of live entertainment careers. The piece serves to chronicle her professional evolution, the strategic expansion of the tour, and the intersection of drag culture with mainstream theatrical productions, offering insights into contemporary performance arts.
